EmailTemplate.subject: New Fiscal Year Calendar
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Colleagues, Beginning February 4, 2017, Pivotal will transition from our current Calendar Year (CY), which ends on December 31, to a new Fiscal Year (FY) based on a 4–4–5 model. Converting to this new FY will synchronize our financial reporting, business processes, and sales cycles with Dell Technologies' Fiscal Year, and will help us maintain operational efficiencies. Our current year follows the calendar, running from January 1 to December 31, with four quarters of three months each. Pivotal’s new 4–4–5 FY will also have four quarters, but each quarter will consist of one four-week period, a second four-week period, and a final five-week period. On February 4, 2017, the FY2018 will begin, and will be structured as follows:
- Q1 FY2018: February 4 – May 5, 2017
- Period 1: (4 Weeks) February 4 – March 3, 2017 - Period 2: (4 Weeks) March 4 – March 31, 2017 - Period 3: (5 Weeks) April 1 – May 5, 2017
- Q2 FY2018: May 6 – August 4, 2017
- Q3 FY2018: August 5 – November 3, 2017
- Q4 FY2018: November 4, 2017 – February 2, 2018
This will not change how Pivotal operates as an independent company, and it is business as usual with our customers. I encourage you to review the 4–4–5 FAQ <[[https://docs.google.com/document/d/180lEOnpzULa9G6inX5qfM5_ZdX_kCsqr8-SQXa9-40g/edit]]>to understand the specifics on what our new fiscal year will look like, the changes and benefits that will come with this new calendar, and how we have prepared for this. Cynthia
